newsitem.title: UK: C&W says no decision on Singapore partners.
newsitem.headline: C&W says no decision on Singapore partners.

text.p: Cable and Wireless, Britain's second biggest telecoms company, said on Monday that it had not finalised details about which companies it would team up with to bid for a telecoms licence in Singapore.
"No decision has been made on the partnerships for this bid," a company spokesman told Reuters.
He said a state television report from Singapore, that the company would tie up with Hong Kong Telecom, two Singapore groups and possibly one other firm was "inaccurate".
Singapore has said it will award up to two additional public telecommunciations services licences.
Foreign interests in joint ventures pursuing a telecoms licence in Singapore are limited to 49 percent.
